name: NbtPredicateHelper
description:
The `NbtPredicateHelper` class is a utility wrapper for Minecraft's `NbtPredicate` that provides a scripting-friendly interface for testing NBT (Named Binary Tag) data against predicate conditions. NBT predicates are powerful filtering tools used to match entities, items, and NBT data based on specific criteria and conditions.

This class is commonly used in world scanning, item filtering, entity targeting, and automation scripts where you need to test if NBT data matches certain patterns or requirements.
overview:
The `NbtPredicateHelper` class provides:

- NBT data testing for entities, items, and raw NBT elements
- Integration with Minecraft's native NBT predicate system
- Support for complex NBT matching conditions
- Use cases in automation, filtering, and targeting systems

constructors.description: Direct instantiation is not recommended. Use factory methods or obtain from other helpers instead.

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: The underlying Minecraft NbtPredicate to wrap

methods.name: test
methods.description: Tests whether the given entity's NBT data matches this NBT predicate.

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: The entity to test against the predicate

methods.name: test
methods.description: Tests whether the given item stack's NBT data matches this NBT predicate.

parameters.name: itemStack
parameters.description: The item stack to test against the predicate

methods.name: test
methods.description: Tests whether the given NBT element matches this NBT predicate.

parameters.name: nbtElement
parameters.description: The NBT element to test against the predicate

methods.name: getRaw
methods.description: Returns the underlying Minecraft NbtPredicate object.
